means: 多配偶（制），一夫多妻（制）或一妻多夫（制）

word_mean: 多配〔合〕：一女或一男同时与一个以上的配偶的婚配，与单配相对。另见polyandry和polygyny
一雄配多雌的交配体制或一雌多雄制。在哺乳动物中常见。

sentence.Network_en: The Mormons, organizing themselves in response to a religious vision, practiced polygamy in all their settlements.
sentence.Network_cn: 摩门教徒按照宗教幻想而组织起来,他们在自己的所有村落里实行一夫多妻制.

sentence.Network_en: So far, the public response to polygamy has been practical , not philosophical.
sentence.Network_cn: 迄今为止, 公众对一夫多妻制的反应一直都是就事论事而缺乏理性认识.

sentence.Network_en: Abuse and coercion are only the most obvious dangers of polygamy.
sentence.Network_cn: 滥交和强迫性行为只是一夫多妻制最显见的危害所在.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 16th cent.: from French polygamie, via late Latin from Greek polugamia, from polugamos 'often marrying'

entry.tran: 多配偶（制）；一夫多妻（制）；一妻多夫（制）
entry.def: Polygamy is the custom in some societies in which someone can be legally married to more than one person at the same time.

means.word_mean: 1. having more than one spouse at a time
